SEARCH
Package game.interfaces

Interface IEntity

All Known Subinterfaces:
IEnemy, IPlayer
All Known Implementing Classes:
Enemy, Entity, Player
public interface IEntity
The ICharacter interface defines the basic contract for any character in the game.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    attack()
    Abstract method that Performs an attack on another character, causing damage.
    Room
    getCurrentRoom()
    Retrieves the room where the character is currently located.

    Retrieves the unique identifier (ID) of the character.

    Retrieves the character's current health points (life).

    Retrieves the character's name.

    Retrieves the current power level of the character.

    Checks if the character is currently alive.

    Sets the character's name to a specified value.
    void

    Reduces the character's health by a specified amount of damage.

  • Method Details

    • getId

      int getId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier (ID) of the character.
      Returns:
      the character's unique ID as an integer.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Retrieves the character's name.
      Returns:
      the character's name as a string.

    • setName

      void setName(String name)
      Sets the character's name to a specified value.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name to assign to the character. Cannot be null.

    • getCurrentRoom

      Room getCurrentRoom()
      Retrieves the room where the character is currently located.
      Returns:
      the current Room object where the character is located.

    • setCurrentRoom

      void setCurrentRoom(Room nextRoom)
      Sets the character's current room to a specified location. This method is used to move the character from one room to another within the game.
      Parameters:
      nextRoom - the new Room object where the character should be placed. Cannot be null.

    • isAlive

      boolean isAlive()
      Checks if the character is currently alive.
      Returns:
      true if the character is alive; false otherwise.

    • getLife

      int getLife()
      Retrieves the character's current health points (life).
      Returns:
      the character's current health as an integer.

    • takeDamage

      void takeDamage(int damage)
      Reduces the character's health by a specified amount of damage.
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage to inflict. Must be a positive integer.

    • attack

      void attack()
      Abstract method that Performs an attack on another character, causing damage. This method must be implemented by subclasses of Entity.

    • getPower

      int getPower()
      Retrieves the current power level of the character. Power represents the character's attack strength.
      Returns:
      the character's current power as an integer.

    • setLife

      void setLife()
      Sets the health of the entity to the initial health value.
